# Divider

import { DarkModeCompatible } from '@site/src/components/DarkModeCompatible';

<DarkModeCompatible />

A lightweight separator for grouping content. Supports horizontal and vertical orientations, optional labels, solid or dashed styles, and built-in spacing.

## Overview

Use `Divider` when you need…

- A subtle separator between content blocks
- Orientation control via `orientation` (horizontal/vertical)
- An optional label via `label` + alignment via `align`
- A solid/dashed line style via `variant`
- Built-in outer spacing via `spacing` and optional constraint via `length`

## Live Demo

<LiveDemo />

## Import

```tsx
import { Divider } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';
```

## Basic Usage

```tsx
<Divider />

<Divider label="Details" />

<Divider orientation="vertical" />
```

## Anatomy

The Divider component renders a simple separator line:

```
Horizontal with label:
─────────  Details  ─────────
   ↑         ↑         ↑
   │         │         └─ Line (right side)
   │         └─────────── Label (optional)
   └─────────────────── Line (left side)

Vertical:
│  ← Single line
│
│
```

**Component Structure:**

- **Container**: Wrapper with `role="separator"` and orientation
- **Lines**: Visual separator elements (solid or dashed)
- **Label** (optional): Text content between horizontal lines
- **Spacing**: Built-in margin based on `spacing` prop

**Visual States:**

- **Horizontal**: Default orientation (full width)
- **Vertical**: For columnar layouts (full height)
- **With Label**: Horizontal divider with centered/aligned text
- **Constrained**: Limited width/height via `length` prop

## API Reference

### Props

| Prop          | Type                             | Default        | Description                                                     |
| ------------- | -------------------------------- | -------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `label`       | `ReactNode`                      | -              | Optional label displayed between the lines (horizontal only)    |
| `orientation` | `'horizontal' \| 'vertical'`     | `'horizontal'` | Direction of the divider                                        |
| `variant`     | `'solid' \| 'dashed'`            | `'solid'`      | Line style                                                      |
| `align`       | `'start' \| 'center' \| 'end'`   | `'center'`     | Label alignment for horizontal dividers                         |
| `spacing`     | `'none' \| 'sm' \| 'md' \| 'lg'` | `'md'`         | Outer spacing (margin) applied around the divider               |
| `length`      | `number \| string`               | -              | Constrain width (horizontal) or height (vertical). Accepts px/% |
| `className`   | `string`                         | -              | Additional CSS classes                                          |

## Best Practices

### Do ✅

- Use `Divider` to separate content groups without adding extra UI chrome
- Use labels sparingly to clarify group meaning (e.g. “Upcoming”, “Or”)
- Prefer `orientation="vertical"` only in clearly columnar layouts

### Don't ❌

- Don’t use dividers as a substitute for spacing; use layout primitives for spacing first
- Don’t stack many labeled dividers; it becomes noisy

## Accessibility

The Divider component is designed with WCAG 2.1 AA compliance in mind:

### Screen Reader Support

**For Decorative Dividers:**

```tsx
<Divider />
// Screen reader announces: "separator" (purely visual, minimal announcement)
```

**For Labeled Dividers:**

```tsx
<Divider label="Additional Details" />
// Screen reader announces: "Additional Details, separator"
```

### Best Practices for Accessibility

#### Do ✅

- Use dividers to visually separate content groups
- Add labels when they clarify the relationship between sections
- Ensure proper semantic structure (headings, sections) alongside dividers
- Use appropriate contrast for divider lines (meets 3:1 minimum)

#### Don't ❌

- Don't rely solely on dividers to convey structure (use headings)
- Don't use dividers as decorative borders (use CSS instead)
- Don't add labels to every divider (only when meaningful)
- Don't nest dividers or use them excessively

### ARIA Attributes

The component automatically handles:

- `role="separator"` - Identifies the element as a visual separator
- `aria-orientation` - Set to "horizontal" or "vertical" based on prop
- Line elements have `aria-hidden="true"` (purely decorative)

### Color Contrast

Divider lines meet WCAG 2.1 AA contrast requirements:

- Border color: Minimum 3:1 contrast ratio against background
- Label text: Minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio
- Works in both light and dark modes

## Common Patterns

### Section Separator

```tsx title="src/components/Article.tsx"
import { Divider } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function Article() {
  return (
    <article>
      <section>
        <h2>Introduction</h2>
        <p>Content...</p>
      </section>

      <Divider spacing="lg" />

      <section>
        <h2>Details</h2>
        <p>Content...</p>
      </section>
    </article>
  );
}
```

### List Section Headers

```tsx title="src/components/SettingsList.tsx"
import { Divider } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function SettingsList() {
  return (
    <div>
      <Divider label="Account" align="start" spacing="sm" />
      <ul>
        <li>Profile settings</li>
        <li>Email preferences</li>
      </ul>

      <Divider label="Privacy" align="start" spacing="sm" />
      <ul>
        <li>Data sharing</li>
        <li>Cookie preferences</li>
      </ul>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Vertical Split Layout

```tsx title="src/components/SplitPanel.tsx"
import { Divider } from '@grasdouble/lufa_design-system';

function SplitPanel() {
  return (
    <div style={{ display: 'flex', minHeight: '300px' }}>
      <div style={{ flex: 1, padding: '1rem' }}>Left content</div>

      <Divider orientation="vertical" spacing="none" />

      <div style={{ flex: 1, padding: '1rem' }}>Right content</div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Related Components

- **Stack** - For spacing and separating content with gaps
- **Card** - Often uses dividers to separate sections
- **Tabs** - Alternative way to organize content into sections
- **Accordion** - For collapsible content sections

## TypeScript Support

The Divider component is fully typed with TypeScript:

```tsx
import type { ReactNode } from 'react';

export type DividerOrientation = 'horizontal' | 'vertical';
export type DividerVariant = 'solid' | 'dashed';
export type DividerAlign = 'start' | 'center' | 'end';
export type DividerSpacing = 'none' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg';

export type DividerProps = {
  label?: ReactNode;
  orientation?: DividerOrientation;
  align?: DividerAlign;
  variant?: DividerVariant;
  spacing?: DividerSpacing;
  className?: string;
  length?: number | string;
};
```

This ensures type safety and autocomplete in your IDE.
